text: Here's how to use an Amazon Fire TV Stick.

If you need help setting
up your Fire Stick,

we've linked a separate video
in the description below.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip through different
parts of this tutorial.

On the homepage, you'll find
the apps you've downloaded
and all your recently watched content.

To remove something
from your recent section
on the homepage, highlight it
and press the options button.
From the pop-up menu,
select "Remove from Recent."
To play an app or channel,
use the arrow keys on your remote
to highlight what you want.
Use the select key on the remote
to advance and open the app.

At the top left, you'll
find the "Find" button
and a "Search" button below.
Go here to find a specific app or channel.
Filter your content under the "Find" tab.
Go to the settings tab to customize
your Amazon Fire TV settings.

Now you can use voice control
on the Amazon Fire TV Stick.

To activate, hold down
the voice-control button
on your remote and say the word "Alexa"
followed by a command.
Let's try some.
Open Netflix.
Play.
Pause.
Next episode.

You can also ask questions
related to music,
weather, news, and games.
What's the weather today?
Play '70s music.

You can use the Alexa function
to add an app quickly.
We'll try adding the Starz app.

Hold down the voice-control
button on your remote
and say, "Alexa, search for Starz app."
From the options, use your arrow buttons

to highlight the one you
need, and then select.

Use the arrow keys to move
the cursor on the screen.

Hover over the "Get"
button, and then select.
Click "Open," and the app will install.
